historySnippet.reasoning: A is already at 1.0 but drifting down (dA/dt=-0.0008), so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) and counter the fade with a small, low-risk reduction in k_A_decay to stabilize agency without disrupting the high C/D regime (history shows k_A_decay tweaks helped slightly at Gen 1717.7).

A is already safely above 0.75 but is slightly fading while C is decaying; since best A occurred at U=0.10 and recent tweaks around k_C_decay/k_A_decay showed minimal gains, keep U at the best-setting and reduce complexity/agency decay slightly to stabilize without hurting D (which is very high).

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising, but Diversity is starting to collapse (dD/dt=-0.0032), so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) while easing selection pressure by lowering k_DU and slightly boosting k_D_growth to stabilize D without sacrificing A (history shows U=0.10 is best-associated and big U moves previously hurt A).

Agency is already well above the 0.75 threshold and still rising (dA/dt>0) while Diversity is only slightly declining, so I’ll keep U at the best-record value and lightly reduce diversity-collapsing pressure (k_DU) to stabilize D without sacrificing A.

A is already at 1.0 but has a small negative drift (dA/dt=-0.0005), so I’ll keep U at the best-record 0.10 while slightly reducing agency decay and boosting agency-from-complexity to counter the fade without harming high C/D (recent tweaks to k_A_decay were mixed, so this is a small, controlled correction).

Agency is already safely above the 0.75 threshold and still rising (dA/dt>0) while complexity is slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) and counter the C drift by nudging k_C_decay down without disrupting the near-optimal A dynamics (noting prior k_C_decay tweaks were mixed, so this is a small, low-risk adjustment).

Agency is already far above the 0.75 objective and still emerging (dA/dt>0), but Diversity has started collapsing (dD/dt<0), so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) while reducing selection pressure on D by reverting k_DU toward the best-record value to stabilize long-run open-endedness (noting the recent k_DU/k_D* tweaks often hurt A).

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising, but Diversity is starting to collapse (dD/dt < 0) so I’ll keep U at the best-record level while slightly reducing selection pressure (k_DU) and quadratic diversity decay (k_D_decay) to stabilize D without sacrificing A.

Agency is already far above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt>0) while complexity is slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the proven best level (0.10) and reduce k_C_decay to arrest C decline without adding selection pressure (history shows lowering k_C_decay was beneficial when paired with stable U).

Agency is already >0.75 and still rising, but D and C have slightly negative drift; since the best record occurs at U=0.10 and recent tweaks often hurt A, keep U at 0.10 and reduce diversity/complexity decay pressures (without increasing k_DU) to stabilize D and C while preserving high A.

name: Diffusion‑Damped Agency Weaver
description: This agent crossed the threshold by tightly coupling agency to complexity (k_AC=0.5) while keeping both volatility (sigma_A=0.005, sigma_C=0.005) and long-term erosion low (k_A_decay=0.0005, k_C_decay=0.01). Its lineage shows repeated agency collapses whenever decay terms or diversity dynamics were perturbed, but a key rebound occurred when diversity-to-difficulty leakage was tuned (k_DU adjusted; k_DU=0.0005), effectively insulating diversity from the low-difficulty environment (U=0.10) and letting agency consolidate rather than dissipate.
